thread.title: UPDATE 1-Canada's Rogers Communications profit slips, revenue up
thread.title_full: UPDATE 1-Canada's Rogers Communications profit slips, revenue up | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 1-Canada's Rogers Communications profit slips, revenue up
text:
(Adds details from earnings statement, analyst comment)
By Alastair Sharp
TORONTO, July 23 (Reuters) - Rogers Communications Inc reported a 10 percent decline in second-quarter net income on Thursday, as the Canadian telecom, cable and media company made progress in its strategy of attracting value over volume in its wireless business.
Toronto-based Rogers posted net income of C$363 million, or 70 Canadian cents a share, in the April-June quarter, compared with C$405 million, or 79 cents a share, a year ago. Its revenue rose almost 6 percent to C$3.4 billion.
On an adjusted basis, the company earned 80 Canadian cents a share, down from 84 cents a year ago.
RBC Capital Markets analyst Drew McReynolds said the results came in "slightly above expectations on higher wireless margins while key operating metrics were largely in line," in a research note, and suggested a neutral reaction from investors.
Rogers gained 24,000 net postpaid wireless subscribers after two quarters of declines. These customers typically spend much more than those who prepay for service.
It also gained 8,000 prepay customers.
The company said a rise in postpaid churn, the portion of those valuable customers leaving each month, and a smaller gain in customers than in the year-ago period were expected as the company moves customers off discounted plans and the industry deals with a regulatory move that makes it easier for customers to switch to rivals.
Rogers shed 32,000 cable-TV subscribers and 11,000 landline telephone lines in the period, but gained 4,000 Internet customers. (Reporting by Alastair Sharp, Editing by Franklin Paul)
